alert.note: Alert for Auglaize; Logan; Mercer; Shelby (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 22 at 6:57AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Central Ohio, including the following counties, Auglaize, Logan, Mercer and Shelby. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 657 AM EST, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Celina, Wapakoneta, St. Marys, Coldwater, New Bremen, Minster, St. Henry, Anna, Fort Loramie, Jackson Center, Fort Recovery, Botkins, New Knoxville, Moulton, Wabash, Chickasaw, Burkettsville, Kettlersville, Montezuma and Bulkhead.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
